org.colomoto.biolqm.modifier.perturbation

Interface LogicalModelPerturbation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPerturbation, FixedValuePerturbation, InteractionPerturbation, MultiplePerturbation, RangePerturbation

    public interface LogicalModelPerturbation
    Common interface for perturbations.
    Author:
    Aurelien Naldi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean affectsNode(NodeInfo node)
      Test if the perturbation affects the function of a specific node
      LogicalModel apply(LogicalModel model)
      Apply the perturbation.
      void restrictValues(byte[] state, List<NodeInfo> components)
      Apply the perturbation(s) directly to a state, i.e., restricts the values of the state in the valid range of the perturbation(s).
      void update(LogicalModel model)
      Apply the perturbation to a model directly (do not create a modified model).

    • Method Detail

      • restrictValues

        void restrictValues(byte[] state,
                    List<NodeInfo> components)
        Apply the perturbation(s) directly to a state, i.e., restricts the values of the state in the valid range of the perturbation(s).
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be restricted
        components - the ordered list of components in the state

      • update

        void update(LogicalModel model)
        Apply the perturbation to a model directly (do not create a modified model). This can be used directly when we do not need to preserve the original model. It is also convenient for multiple perturbations, to avoid creating intermediate models.
        Parameters:
        model - the modified model

      • affectsNode

        boolean affectsNode(NodeInfo node)
        Test if the perturbation affects the function of a specific node
        Parameters:
        node - a component of the model
        Returns:
        true if component is affected by this perturbation

      • apply

        LogicalModel apply(LogicalModel model)
        Apply the perturbation.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to modify
        Returns:
        the modified model after applying the perturbation
